audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: This describes internal deployment efficiency improvements, not business model transformation. Faster deployments are operational optimization.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics from first-party source, but describes Tier 1 optimization activity.
audited_claims.notes: Clear Tier 1 operational efficiency claim - faster internal deployments don't constitute strategic transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Increased deployment frequency is process optimization, not strategic transformation. This is about doing existing work faster/more frequently.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics from credible source, but fundamentally a Tier 1 efficiency gain.
audited_claims.notes: Another Tier 1 operational efficiency metric - more frequent deployments don't change the business model

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Hardware resource reduction is cost optimization, not business model change. Classic Tier 1 efficiency improvement.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific percentage range from first-party source, but describes cost savings not transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Clear Tier 1 cost reduction claim - using less hardware is operational efficiency, not strategic transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Infrastructure consolidation is internal IT optimization, not strategic business model change. Reduces complexity but doesn't create new value propositions.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics (10 to 1 clusters) from credible source, but describes internal efficiency.
audited_claims.notes: Infrastructure consolidation is Tier 1 operational improvement - doesn't change how Ocado creates value for customers

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Demonstrates scale of Ocado's automated fulfillment platform - the core technology they license to other retailers. This is evidence of their transformation from retailer to technology platform provider.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics (tens of thousands weekly, 200k orders at capacity) with named facility location. Credible operational data.
audited_claims.notes: Shows the operational capability that underpins Ocado's platform business model - the technology they license to partners

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Self-service analytics adoption is internal process improvement, not business model transformation. Enables better decision-making but doesn't change value creation model.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific user count (700 weekly active) from credible source, but describes internal efficiency gains.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Internal analytics adoption is Tier 1 - improves decision-making efficiency but doesn't transform the business model

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: External reporting capability could support platform business model by providing insights to OSP partners, but unclear if this is customer-facing or internal reporting.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific timeline (3 months) from credible source, but ambiguous whether 'external' means customer-facing or just outside internal teams.
audited_claims.notes: Ambiguous - could be platform capability for partners (tier 1) or just external compliance reporting (Tier 1). Needs clarification.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Internal platform adoption metrics describe organizational efficiency improvements, not strategic transformation. More users accessing analytics is process optimization.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics (2,000 employees, 9 analyst teams) from credible source, but describes internal adoption.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Internal analytics platform adoption is Tier 1 - organizational efficiency improvement, not business model change

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Reusable metrics and consistency gains are internal process improvements, not strategic transformation. Classic efficiency optimization.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Qualitative description from first-party source, but clearly describes internal efficiency gains.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Metric reusability and consistency are Tier 1 operational efficiencies - don't change the fundamental business model

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Demonstrates successful OSP platform deployment creating market leadership for a partner. This validates Ocado's transformation from retailer to technology platform provider enabling others' success.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific market position claims (leading in Catalonia, highest-rated in Spain) with named partner and third-party validation (OCU rating).
audited_claims.notes: Strong evidence of platform business model success - Ocado's technology enabling partner market leadership validates the transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Describes the core value proposition of Ocado's platform business - providing automated fulfillment technology that enables profitable online grocery operations for partners.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Qualitative but specific claim about the platform's value proposition from credible source. Describes the fundamental economic benefit Ocado provides to partners.
audited_claims.notes: Captures the essence of Ocado's platform transformation - selling automation technology that solves online grocery profitability for partners

tier_verification: This case contains both tier 1 and tier 1 elements. Claims C1-C4, C6, C8-C9 are clearly tier 1 operational improvements (deployment efficiency, resource optimization, internal analytics adoption). Claims C5, C10-C11 are genuine tier 1 transformation evidence showing Ocado's platform business model in action. C7 needs review for clarification. The case should focus on the platform licensing business model, not internal operational improvements.
